creator: jhoare@ihug.com.au
text:
I get the following error when using the apache-tomcat webapp extension (new
one). The servlet code uses the getParameter method to access the content of a
form (text). This is not returning anything (parameters are sent using the post
method). Note this all works ok if Tomcat is accessed directly (via port 8080). 

I have recompiled both the .so and warp.jar files but still get this error. I
notice that other parameters, such as remotehost are also return null.

Starting service Tomcat-Standalone
Apache Tomcat/4.0-b6
Starting service Tomcat-Apache
Apache Tomcat/4.0-b6
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.RequestStream.read(RequestStream.java:188)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.RequestStream.close(RequestStream.java:159)
        at
org.apache.catalina.connector.RequestBase.finishRequest(RequestBase.java:505)
        at
org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpRequestHandler.handle(WarpRequestHandler.java:175)
        at
org.apache.catalina.connector.warp.WarpConnection.run(WarpConnection.java:194)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

text:
This works fine for me now. I think Mark mentioned that Constants.java.in was
short a couple of definitions. I have tried (quickly) all my servlets + the ones
from examples. They work fine, the only thing that wouldn't work was the jndi
example (naming) it complains that maxExceptions is not bound under this
context, but works ok using port 8080.
 Thanks for the fix -- Jeff
